column2: NEW YORK DMV WRITTEN TEST
column6: NY

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. What do warning signs mean?
column4: Drivers are approaching a hazardous location.
column6: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.

column2: 2. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: move as far away from traffic as possible.
column6: pull as far away from the roadside shoulder as possible.
column8: always park on the left side of the roadway.

column2: 3. Does a vehicle prepared to enter a traffic circle or rotary have right-of-way over vehicles in the circle?
column4: Only if the light is green.
column6: Yes, but only if they are entering the rotary from the right lane.
column10: No. Vehicles already in the circle have the right-of-way.

column2: 4. Drivers with probationary licenses who text while driving will receive a ___-day suspension for first convictions and revocations of ___________ for subsequent convictions within six months of the time a license is restored after suspension.
column6: 90; nine months

column2: 5. If you are in a traffic crash that involves a fatality or personal injury, you must report it to DMV within:
column6: 5 days.

column2: 6. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
column6: No one.
column8: The driver who does not control the car.

column2: 7. A broken white line:
column4: means passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane.
column6: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction.
column8: marks the right edge of the roadway.

column2: 8. This sign means:
column4: Bicycles should yield to vehicles ahead.
column6: Warning: a bikeway crosses the roadway ahead.
column8: The lane ahead is reserved for bicycles.

column2: 9. The sign in the picture:
column6: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column8: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.
column10: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.

column2: 10. A 5 oz. glass of wine (12% alcohol) contains enough alcohol to increase BAC by about:
11. Following another vehicle too closely is known as:
column6: closetailing.

column2: 12. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column4: find a safe place to stop for a break.
column6: have a beer or two to keep you awake.
column8: turn on the radio to keep you awake.

column2: 13. What does this road sign indicate?
column6: Hill area
column10: Area reserved for people with disabilities

column2: 14. Your BAC depends on:
column4: the amount of alcohol you drink.
column6: the type of beverage you drink.

column2: 15. Low beam headlights must be turned on:
column4: when driving between sunset and sunrise.
column6: during any rain, fog or smoke.
column8: during the twilight hours between full night and sunrise.

column2: 16. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column4: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.
column6: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.
column10: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.

column2: 17. Your headlights must be on low beam within ______ of a vehicle ahead of you.
column6: 500 feet

column2: 18. A bicycle driven on public highways must have a horn or bell that can be heard at least ________ away.
column6: 50 feet

column2: 19. If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?
column6: Before the crosswalk.

column2: 20. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: turn left into the one-way road.
column6: make a U-turn into the two-way road.
column8: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.
column10: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
